cards.flavor_text: [i]When detached from a person and dipped in the mutagenic ooze left by the Phyrexians an eye makes an excellent spying tool.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The Chimeras were an ancient Phyrexian project gone wrong.[/i]

cards.rules_text: You gain life equal to your life total.

cards.rules_text: Exile all nonland permanents.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Koth's rage can destroy everything but the land itself.[/i]

At the beginning of your upkeep, put a flood counter on target land. That land is an Island for as long as it has a flood counter on it. [i](The land continues to be flooded after Merfolk Tidecaller has left the battlefield.)[/i]

Deep Sea Merfolk can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.

cards.flavor_text: [i]The caverns under the arenas stretch far in every direction, some even out under the ocean. One bad storm could flood cavern network, cutting off the caverns forever.[/i]

cards.rules_text:

cards.flavor_text: [i]The lost library of Urza is a floating island whose location has been lost to time.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Few scholars have the opportunity to study the old Phyrexian books, and even fewer survive long enough to make use of that information.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The Yixlid are a small group of zombies selected from the greatest warriors in the arena resurrected by Fulgusar and used by Rasusar to watch the prisoners in the jails under the arenas.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Phyrexians push their warriors to the absolute limits of their power.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The few surviving dragons of Moag have been modified by Jaxusar to have extra shielding from magic.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Koth took many students during his time on Moag, but few were strong enough to harness the land to its full extent.[/i]

Creatures you control have double strike and deal damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.

cards.flavor_text: [i]Some goblins think Koth is the messenger of their ancient god Kalesar and many have returned to the ancient traditions to worship him.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Arm target creature you control, it fights target creature you don't control. [i](Create a colorless Equipment artifact token named Weapon attached to that creature with equip {2} and “Equipped creature gets +1/+1.”)[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The Phyrexians use everything they can to its fullest, often destroying the world around them in the process.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever a source deals damage to you, Channel Lightning deals that much damage minus one to that source's controller.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The mages of Kalisuva didn't learn to harness lightning till recently when they watched Fulgusar's magic.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Few brave souls try to ride treefolk. Even fewer succeed.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The ooze underneath Rasusar's arenas must be carefully contained, otherwise it will split and will eat till it consumes everything on the plane. [/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The reptiles of Casesuva are incredibly sensitive to the Phyrexian mutagens and some have grown to ten times their normal size. [/i]
[i]Ancient legends say that all the Treefolk were born from the forests of Casesuva growing over living things.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]While the Phyrexians have learned a lot of lessons over the thousands of years that they've been on Moag, but their experiments still don't always go well.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The forests of Casesuva are one of the few places where the Phyrexians can't touch.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Inspired by Koth's tales of her sister's heroism on New Phyrexia, Kelapeth Tirel became the last line of resistance left on Moag.[/i]
